info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Oil Wood Stain is available in various shades to bring out the natural tone in wood. It highlights wood grain and adds freshness and color. It provides superb protection for interior woodworks.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: For enhancing wood grain on interior wood works and other surfaces such as cabinets, furniture, paneling, etc.

info.title: SERVICE CONDITIONS
info.body: The final color achieved by any wood stain will be affected by the natural color of the wood. Even wood from the same species may vary in color. It is always recommended to test the stain first on a small area to ensure that the final color is as desired.

info.title: MATERIAL PREPARATION
info.body: Thoroughly shake the can before opening.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.body:
Sand surface until the wooden surface is smooth to the touch and no slivers or rough edges remain.
Dust off surfaces completely then wipe with a clean rag. If repainting, remove all paint by wire brushing or scraping.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.body: Using a brush, apply BOYSEN®® Oil Wood Stain to bare wood without primers or undercoats. Lightly brush or wipe over once along the grain to remove excess material and to smooth out any runs. Leave each coat for about 4-8 hours or until totally dry. Recoat for a darker shade.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: New Wood
info.body: 1st coat: BOYSEN®® Oil Wood Stain (any desired color) Intermediate coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer B‑1254 Topcoat: BOYSEN®® Clear Gloss Lacquer B‑1250 BOYSEN®® Clear Dead Flat Lacquer B‑1253 BOYSEN®® Water White Clear Gloss Lacquer B‑1258
